fr.sorbonne_u.components.ext.sync.components

Class SemaphoreComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ext.sync.components.SemaphoreComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, SemaphoreI

    public class SemaphoreComponent
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
implements SemaphoreI
    The class SemaphoreComponent implements the famous synchronizer by embedding a Java standard semaphore object into a component exposing the core part of its interface as a component interface.

    Description

    The major implementation choice is to have a passive component, without any thread, so that its code is directly executed by the threads of its client components. When a call comes from the same JVM, the thread of the client may be blocked. When the call comes from another JVM through RMI, the internal RMI thread used to call the semaphore component may be blocked and in such a case the thread of the client will also be blocked.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2019-04-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
